alert.note: Alert for Hill County; Northern Blaine County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 15 at 8:51PM MDT until further notice by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed to Minor severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Montana... Lodge Creek near International Border affecting Northern Blaine County and Hill County zones. .Snow melt and increased reservoir releases may cause the river flows to become high. Possible minor flooding downstream from the dam. For the Lodge Creek...including International Border...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Lodge Creek near International Border. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.3 feet, April 24 2018 - The Lodge Creek rose to near 10.3 feet this year. No impacts were reported, yet areal flooding did occur because of snowmelt in northern Hill and northern Blaine counties. The gauge is actually in southern Alberta. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:25 PM MDT Saturday the stage was 7.75 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tonight, but may reach flood stage and even moderate flood stage as early as Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet and moderate flood stage is 9.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 1000 AM MDT.
